meanings.definition: Poke or jab with a pointed object
meanings.sent1: She prodded the cake with a fork to see if it was done.
meanings.sent2: The farmer prodded the haystack with a pitchfork looking for his lost tool.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat prodded the sleeping dog with its paw, hoping for a reaction.
meanings.sent4: His words prodded at her conscience like sharp needles.
meanings.sent5: The detective prodded for clues in the crime scene, searching for any leads.

meanings.definition: Urge or persuade someone to do something
meanings.sent1: She prodded her friend to try the new ice cream flavor.
meanings.sent2: The coach prodded the team to give their best performance in the final game.
meanings.sent3: The children prodded their dad to take them to the amusement park.
meanings.sent4: His curiosity prodded him to explore the mysterious cave despite the warnings.
meanings.sent5: The motivational speaker prodded the audience to chase their dreams with determination.
